rationale: Although there are localised threats, this is a widespread and common species in suitable habitats. It is therefore listed as Least Concern. It has also been assessed regionally as Least Concern for central and southern Africa.
assessor: Marshall, B., Moelants, T. & Tweddle, D.
evaluator: Snoeks, J., Tweddle, D., Getahun, A., Lalèyè, P., Paugy, D., Zaiss, R., Fishar, M.R.A & Brooks, E.
